result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan R Luna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Juan R Luna is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Juan R Luna was found guilty of Battery AMENDED FROM Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Juan R Luna was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property AMENDED FROM Burglary-Commit a Battery on Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Terminated - regular
Per RCSO, DNA collected - 10-12-2015 at 10:40 am

Defendant Juan R Luna in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Battery and Ct. 2 to Misd CDTP.
Plea:  Cts. 1&2 - G.
BTC:  Cts. 1&2 - GUILTY.  Ct. 3 - DISMISS.
Ct. 1:  
8 mo RCJ, I/S, 1 year probation.
Ct. 2:
Withheld sentence, 1 year probation.

Conditions:
11 days RCJ, cfts;
No alc/cs;
AODA;
No contact w/ victim;
CC+DNA surcharge - provide sample.  
Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant Juan R Luna in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Trial remains.
allowing Atty Cafferty to be substituted in place of Atty. Aneeq Ahmad.
Final pre-trial on October 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial on October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Atty Cafferty.
from Atty Cafferty.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, IG (person, property, residence or family).   No contact with the co-defendant, AH.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.    Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

DEF: motion for bond
